Important farm items
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher DS Archive (DS): Japanese DS Games Archive: Monster Farm DS 2: Misc. QA (post all new topics here, well make more sections later) : Important farm items
By Thorr on Wednesday, August 20, 2008 - 06:26 am:

As in most MR games, there are important items to have on your farm to help your monsters maintain Stability. In MFDS, these items could only be obtained through Tournaments. It seems to be the same in MFDS2. So, using the basic calendar, here is a list in progress of the items and how/when they can be won. As far as I can tell, each unique items has a stacking effect with each other, but duplicate items do not.

Artemis Statue (Reduced Fatigue) - Class D 9/1
Water Pitcher (Reduced Stress) - Class D 6/1
ShyShy blanket (reduced stress)- Class D 8/3
Ice block (reduced stress)- Class B 9/1
Cricket Bell (reduced stress) -
Old Hearth (Reduced Fatigue)- Class A 2/3
Music Box (Rest is more effective)-

By Thorr on Monday, August 25, 2008 - 10:37 am:

BTW, I want to say here that these items are EXTREMELY helpful once you have them. I think the Old Hearth has to be the best one. I can now go on an expedition and come back only half tired. I can also do 3 hard drills in a row and rest up on a single week.

By Thorr on Friday, August 29, 2008 - 07:13 am:

The wiki I found gives more info on these items and why you need ALL of them. (Wiki confirms that the last 2 items are indeed in the game.)

ItemEffect Tourney
Artemis StatueReduces Fatigue on FIRST week of the each monthClass D 9/1
Water Pitcher Reduces Stress on FIRST week of every monthClass D 6/1
ShyShy blanketReduced Stress during SPRINGClass D 8/3
Ice block Reduces Stress during SUMMERClass B 9/1
Cricket BellReduces Stress during FALLClass C 9/1
Old Hearth Reduces Stress during WINTERClass A 2/3
Music Box Rest is more effectiveClass S 10/4


I made this table based on what I know and what the wiki fills in. The wiki provided the names of the tourneys but not the dates. The tourney names helped me find the missing dates (that I apparently missed while looking through the calendar before). But knowing the seasons for each of the Stress items is really helpful and explains why there are so many in the first place.
